title: Looking for a windsong alternative
content: I am in need of a delicate script font, something very feminine and light, for use in various promo materials for my wedding photography business. I really like windsong ( [http://www.dafont.com/windsong.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404231247/http:/www.dafont.com/windsong.font "http://www.dafont.com/windsong.font")), but the loopy lowercase d drives me insane, especially since "wedding" requires it to be doubled up, which just looks tacky and wrong. I have tried modifying the more subtle lowercase b, but without much luck. Any suggestions for a similar look?
author: stacyreeves

comments.content:
Try this site for some great script fonts - [www.sudtipos.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404231247/http:/www.sudtipos.com/ "www.sudtipos.com") and select any of the of Bluemlein Script Collection fonts. They're classics!

JH

Apart from Sudtipos, which is an excellent choice, try

[Voluta Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404231247/http:/www.identifont.com/show?XL)  
 [Liorah](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404231247/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/liorah/bt/)  
 [Dearest](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404231247/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-dearest/)  
 [Johann Sparkling](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404231247/http:/www.identifont.com/show?3EH)  
or the classic [Cezanne](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404231247/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/cezanne/)
